page.title: 05Barnby in the W. Farming 1
page.content: There are about a dozen agricultural holdings in the parish but only one dairy farm. This farm lies close to the centre of the village and has land on both sides of the River Witham. With an average height above sea level of 35ft. the water table is fairly high making the farm suitable for milk production off grass. 125 acres entirely down to grass support 90 milking cows and 50 young stock as replacements for the herd. Full time labour is the farmer, his wife and one employee. All the stock is housed in the winter and forage, obtained from the farm chiefly as hay, is stored in barns. Brewers grains are used as additional bulk feed and are readily obtainable locally. Straw is plentiful on local farms and is used for bedding. Three tractors are used on the farm.
